items.message: River levels remain higher than normal but are falling. Flooding may affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly low-lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Further rainfall is expected today and tomorrow, and river levels are expected to rise again in response. We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue further alerts and warnings if required. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water and consider activating any flood protection products you may have. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 23/11/2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 22 November 2025 . 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. River levels at Pillings Lock Gauge are rising due to today's rainfall. Light rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses & plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers. 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 23 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Stour and Smestow Brook in the Black Country and South Staffordshire
items.message:
Rising river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the afternoon of 22 November 2025 . 
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads around Halesowen, Stourbridge, Wombourne, Kingswinford and Kinver. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 23 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high and the potential for flooding continues today, 22 November 2025. 
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 23 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea,  throughout today may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible today, Saturday 22 November, and for the next few days.

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time.

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on Sunday 23 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message: River levels remain high throughout the day and flooding is possible. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, particularly in the Low Marishes area. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 22 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message:
High river levels over the next two days may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the morning of 22 November 2025 . 
Areas most at risk include the Rivers Lim, Char, Winniford, Simene, Brit, Asker, Mangerton and Bride. Properties at Church Street, Burton Bradstock may need to prepare their pumps with continuing rainfall and rising river levels. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:30AM on 23 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
